snippet: Canada plans to shut the rail operator whose tanker train blew up in a Quebec town last month, killing 47 people,  because the company does not have enough insurance to pay for cleanup costs.
abstract: Canada plans to shut down Montreal, Maine & Atlantic Railway, rail operator whose tanker trains blew up in small Quebec town in July, killing 47 people, because company does not have enough insurance to pay for cleanup costs and other damage.
lead_paragraph: Canada plans to shut the rail operator whose tanker train blew up in a Quebec town last month, killing 47 people,  because the company does not have enough insurance to pay for cleanup costs.

headline.main: Canada: Railroad Company to Be Shut Down
headline.print_headline: Canada: Railroad to Be Shut Down
